 Summary: This takes place soon after Itou joined the Shinsengumi. A little=

n.net/s/2664997/1/ 
   
   
  MORNING MADNESS!
   
   
  =93Poor little thi=
ng,=94 Souji sighed that morning as he lay beside Toshi, his long fingers c=
urled around the man=92s limp arousal. =93I don=92t think he gets nearly en=
ough fun.=94
   
  Toshi grunted, but at least his eyes were focused on him=
 now. =93What have you got in mind?=94
   
  =93Oh,=94 he mused, =93a littl=
e variety maybe. Something special.=94
   
  The entrapped member twitched =
in apparent agreement despite the brooding silence. Toshi=92s eyes narrowed=
 suspiciously. =93You are always asking for favours.=94
   
  Souji blew at=
 the dark strands of hair that had fallen into Toshi=92s eyes. =93Maybe,=94=
 he said with a slight, endearing pout, =93but you could always say no.=94
=
   
  A moment of careful consideration, and then: =93What is it?=94
   
  =
Souji sat back on his heels, the minx smile in his eyes. =93I was with Sann=
an yesterday. It appears that Itou-sensei enjoys your company tremendously.=
 He couldn=92t understand why you brushed him off repeatedly.=94 He paused =
for effect. =93That was very rude, Hijikata-san.=94
   
  =93Rude?=94 Toshi=
 was incredulous. =93Of course I had to be rude. Look, he=92s just=85 he=92=
s creepy.=94 He shuddered as he recalled the times the conniving bastard ma=
de various excuses to get up close and personal with him. He scratched his =
neck nervously. =93It=92s disgusting; I wouldn=92t touch him with a bargepo=
le.=94
   
  =93Oh, I know that, Hijikata-san,=94 said Souji, languidly rea=
rranging his limbs to accommodate the upthrust member. Its owner grunted in=
 appreciation as Souji=92s firm bottom sank slowly on his middle, making im=
mediate contact possible. He brushed his fringe back from his eyes with a s=
lender forearm. =93What I meant was, maybe you should stop avoiding him. It=
ou-sensei would feel much better if you talked to him directly instead of a=
ttempting to communicate with him through Sannan as you are doing now.=94
 =
  
  =93No way,=94 said Toshi irritably, thrusting his pelvis urgently sinc=
e Souji did not seem to be performing with usual dedication. =93I thought y=
ou would know me better than most.=94
   
  Souji looked down upon him seve=
rely. Certain muscles of his contracted. Toshi winced.
   
  =93Souji! Stop=
 that!=94 The pressure eased off and Toshi gasped. =93Where did you learn t=
hat trick?=94
   
  =93Learn?=94 Souji said with a straight face. =93I didn=
=92t learn that: it=92s a form of exercise.=94 The corners of his mouth twi=
tched. =93One has to exercise to remain fit, no?=94
   
  =93Right, so exer=
cise.=94 Toshi frowned. =93But don=92t practice on me.=94
   
  =93Yes, sir=
!=94 Souji grinned; he leaned forward slightly, his long hair a feathery se=
nsation on Toshi=92s chest. =93So, when are you going to talk to him =96 pr=
operly?=94
   
  The frown deepened. =93Sannan is handling him pretty well,=
 isn=92t he? Why can=92t we leave things as they are now?=94
   
  =93Reall=
y, you shouldn=92t be so uptight, Hijikata-san. Itou-sensei has approached =
several others as well, even Hajime-san.=94
   
  =93That=92s different,=94=
 Toshi said stubbornly.
   
  =93No, it=92s not,=94 Souji was equally stubb=
orn. He swung off and stood up, rubbing his toned abdomen with one hand as =
he breathed in deeply. Toshi watched the filtered sunlight glisten on the p=
ale skin and wished fervently he would get back to what he had been doing. =

   
  =93I=92ve been talking it over with Sannan, you know, and I agree,=
=94 Souji was serious now. =93For the Shinsengumi to remain cohesive, there=
 must not be dissension within its ranks. And the last person you want to a=
ntagonise would probably be the Military Advisor. Even Kondou-san agrees wi=
th us. At least he didn=92t say anything when we brought it up.=94
   
  =
=93He=92s not supposed to say anything,=94 Toshi pointed out. =93He has to =
remain neutral.=94
   
  =93I feel sure he agrees with us,=94 Souji insiste=
d. He planted his feet firmly apart, hands on hips, frowning down at the ot=
her man. Toshi had an agonisingly splendid view of what he wanted most in t=
he world at the moment.
   
  =93Well, maybe=85 if=85=94 he started hesitan=
tly.
   
  Souji smiled, apparently relenting, then knelt and performed for=
 only a tantalisingly few seconds that other operation which was so preciou=
s to Toshi. Then he slid his mouth up Toshi=92s chest and to his ear. He wh=
ispered.
   
  =93No!=94 Toshi exploded, shaking his head vehemently.
   
 =
 He whispered again, telling Toshi what he would not do ever again if he di=
d not grant him this one, tiny, insignificant favour. He groaned: Souji=92s=
 hand was busy.
   
  Then he told him what he would do if he did just that=
 tiny little thing for him.
   
  =93Alright,=94 he gave in.
   
  =93When?=
=94
   
  =93Soon. Not now, of course. Soon.=94
   
  And Souji laughed, a =
bright sound, descending from a high note like bells.
   
   The End
   
  =
 
  Right. This is the tragic result when too much caffeine overwhelms the =
author=92s mind. Late night (early morning) madness! Sorry if the character=
s (and author) are OOC. This is a one-time madness. I promise it would not =
happen again. 
   
  My titles are really bad. They either contain =91The=
=92 or bad alliteration. Suggestions for a better title would definitely be=
 considered. 
   
  Anyone wants to read the sequel about Toshi=92s fateful=
 encounter with dear Itou-sensei? Tell me, yes?
   
  Meanwhile, please rev=
iew if you are reading this. Yes. Collapses from sheer exhaustion.
